de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.analyzer
Interface Analyzer

All Known Subinterfaces:
Analyzer.ChurnAnalyzer, Analyzer.NetAnalyzer, Analyzer.OperationAnalyzer, Analyzer.TransAnalyzer
All Known Implementing Classes:
MedianSessionLengthAnalyzer, MemoryUsageAnalyzer, NetWorkloadAnalyzer
public interface Analyzer

In general, analyzers are used to receive notifications about actions that took place on specific components, for instance the sending or receiving of messages. In particular, analyzers are able to collect data during a simulation run and prepare the results at the end of a simulation. Note that analyzers must be registered by an implementation of the Monitor interfaceby using the xml configuration file before the simulation starts.

Version:
3.0, 12/03/2007
Author:
Sebastian Kaune, Konstantin Pussep

Nested Class Summary
static interface Analyzer.ChurnAnalyzer
          OperationAnalyzers receive notifications when the network connectivity has been changed of churn affected hosts
static interface Analyzer.NetAnalyzer
          NetAnalyzers receive notifications when a network message is send, received or dropped at the network layer.
static interface Analyzer.OperationAnalyzer
          OperationAnalyzers receive notifications when a operation is finished either with or without success.
static interface Analyzer.TransAnalyzer
          TransAnalyzers receive notifications when a network message is sent, or received at the transport layer.
 
Method Summary
 void start()
          Invoking this method denotes start running analyzer
 void stop(java.io.Writer output)
          Invoking this method denotes stop running analyzer.
 

Method Detail

start

void start()
Invoking this method denotes start running analyzer

stop

void stop(java.io.Writer output)
Invoking this method denotes stop running analyzer. Furthermore, all results have to be prepared and printed out using the given writer

Parameters:
output - the given output writer
